name: Mom (Season 4)
summary: On March 25, 2016, the series was renewed for a fourth season.
info:

  • 集数: 22
  • 开始: 2016-10-27
  • 类型: 喜剧
  • 国家/地区: 美国

eps.name: High-tops and Brown Jacket
eps.desc: Adam surprises Bonnie by returning home early. Not wanting to kick the renter out of his home yet, Adam stays at Bonnie's apartment and the two start to discover each other's flaws. Meanwhile, Jill agrees to play "wingman" for Christy at a different AA meeting where there are lots of single men, but Jill then gets jealous when a guy is interested in Christy instead of her.

eps.name: Sword Fights and a Dominican Shortstop
eps.desc:
Jeanine speaks at the ladies' AA meeting and later visits with Bonnie and Christy. Upon learning that Christy is stressed over juggling two jobs, four college classes and kids, Jeanine suggests she quit school and her current jobs to work at her real estate firm. Though Christy finds the offer tempting, she ultimately decides to stay in school. Meanwhile, Adam is fascinated to learn that Bonnie had a brief lesbian relationship with Jeanine, and he has many questions.

Title meaning: Adam's comment about showering with other guys and the former occupation of one of Jeanine's employees.

eps.name: Sparkling Water and Ba-dinkers
eps.desc: When Adam wants to get high before having sex with Bonnie, Bonnie thinks it means she has become undesirable. It turns out that something entirely different is at work.

eps.name: Curious George and the Big Red Nightmare
eps.desc:
Christy is furious when Baxter and Candace take Roscoe home with news that they caught him smoking marijuana. Christy is sure Roscoe got the weed from Baxter's stash, but Baxter insists he's given it up. Also, Christy has a video chat with Violet who claims to be very happy with her job in Lake Tahoe, but Christy sees through it.

Title meaning: A boxed set of books Baxter bought for Candace's family member and Christy's nickname for Candace.

eps.name: Blow and a Free McMuffin
eps.desc:
After rescuing a sick Violet stricken with mono, Christy and Bonnie try to get to the bottom of the story of what truly happened. However, Violet surprises everyone by getting back together with Luke.

Title meaning: The reasons for which Christy has used men in the past.

eps.name: Xanax and a Baby Duck
eps.desc:
Still reeling from Roscoe using pot and drinking, Christy never lets her son out of her sight, even taking him to a meeting and later getting mad at Adam for drinking beer in front of Roscoe.

Title meaning: A drug Baxter says he now needs and Wendy's story about being over-protective.

eps.name: Cornbread and a Cashmere Onesie
eps.desc:
On the 20th anniversary of her mother's suicide, Jill laments her own lonely life and decides to have a child. Christy tries to talk Jill out of it, which only angers Jill and causes her to question their friendship.

Absent: Sadie Calvano as Violet, Blake Garrett Rosenthal as Roscoe, Matt L. Jones as Baxter and William Fichtner as Adam

Title meaning: An item Bonnie serves at a soup kitchen and something Jill sees in a high-end baby catalogue.

eps.name: Freckled Bananas and a Little Schwinn
eps.desc:
While Bonnie and Christy look for a gift for Jill, the clerk at the posh boutique subtly pokes fun at their socioeconomic status, causing Christy to steal a pair of Prada sunglasses in anger. Bonnie chastises Christy for her criminal behavior, but she then uses Adam's handicap placard to get a good parking space at a convenience store.

Absent: Sadie Calvano as Violet, Blake Garrett Rosenthal as Roscoe and Matt L. Jones as Baxter

Title meaning: A dollar store item Bonnie mentions and the mode of transportation for the cop who issues Bonnie a parking ticket.

eps.name: Bad Hand and British Royalty
eps.desc:
Bonnie is excited to meet Adam's best friend Mitch (Bradley Whitford) and his wife Leanne (Nicole Sullivan) who are coming to town to visit Napa wine country. But the two turn out to be hardcore partiers and never leave Bonnie's place after getting stinking drunk. Leanne also reveals that she slept with Adam multiple times before she met Mitch, something Adam never told Bonnie.

Absent: Sadie Calvano as Violet, Blake Garrett Rosenthal as Roscoe and Matt L. Jones as Baxter

Title meaning: A game Mitch plays so he can grope Bonnie's butt and a lie Adam tells about Leanne.

eps.name: A Safe Word and a Rib Eye
eps.desc:
Christy learns that Jill is about seven weeks pregnant and that she is not invited to Jill's baby shower, which makes her angry. A day later, Jill has a miscarriage and Christy goes to apologize but is turned away. Christy later realizes she projected her own issues with being the child of an addict onto Jill, and eventually is able to make a more genuine apology.

Absent: Sadie Calvano as Violet, Blake Garrett Rosenthal as Roscoe, Matt L. Jones as Baxter and William Fichtner as Adam

Title meaning: Bonnie's advice to Marjorie on her sex life and a midnight snack Bonnie enjoys at Jill's house.

eps.name: Good Karma and the Big Weird
eps.desc:
Christy meets a handsome man named Nick (Chris Pratt) outside the ladies' diner, and learns that he is Marjorie's nephew. Despite Marjorie forbidding any of the women to date Nick, Christy pursues him and later regrets it.

Absent: Sadie Calvano as Violet, Blake Garrett Rosenthal as Roscoe, Matt L. Jones as Baxter and William Fichtner as Adam

Title meaning: The reward Christy offers Nick for lending her parking meter change and the name she later calls Nick.

eps.name: Wind Chimes and a Bottomless Pit of Sadness
eps.desc:
Bonnie steals some cookies from Adam's place and shares them with Christy. The two become high, and later share the cookies with Jill and Wendy after an AA meeting. A panicked Adam contacts Bonnie to tell her the cookies contain marijuana, causing all of the women to worry over losing their sobriety.

Title meaning: An idea Bonnie gets while high and Jill's share at an AA meeting.

eps.name: A Bouncy Castle and an Aneurysm
eps.desc:
When hung-over Adam decides to spend Saturday in bed, a fed-up Bonnie goes to their scheduled wine and cheese festival alone and meets Joe (David James Elliott), a local restaurateur. The two immediately have a connection, forcing Bonnie to hide the truth from Adam.

Absent: Sadie Calvano as Violet, Matt L. Jones as Baxter and Blake Garrett Rosenthal as Roscoe

Title meaning: A joke Bonnie makes about her green entrance bracelet to the festival and a lie that Christy tells Adam to cover Bonnie.

eps.name: Roast Chicken and a Funny Story
eps.desc:
After Adam breaks up with her following a kiss from Joe, Bonnie finds herself in a stupor. When her attitude becomes too much for the girls to handle, Christy hopes that Adam will reconsider a future with her mother.

Absent: Sadie Calvano as Violet, Matt L. Jones as Baxter and Blake Garrett Rosenthal as Roscoe

Title meaning: The meal Bonnie prepares for Adam and her story about the neighbor's pan she borrowed to accommodate the size of the chicken.

eps.name: Night Swimmin' and an English Muffin
eps.desc:
Bonnie and Adam are back together, alternately having raucous sex and loud arguments. One argument is over Adam responding to a text from his ex-wife during sex, and he later admits to Bonnie that he's still trying to get his ex to sign divorce papers. Bonnie confronts the ex, Danielle (Wendie Malick), and surmises she is still hoping to get back together with Adam.

Absent: Sadie Calvano as Violet, Matt L. Jones as Baxter and Blake Garrett Rosenthal as Roscoe

Title meaning: An activity Jill would propose to male suitors and a snack Bonnie has when she breaks into Danielle's house.

eps.name: Martinis and a Sponge Bath
eps.desc:
Christy and Adam get into a car accident, and Bonnie's feelings are hurt when she discovers she is not the emergency contact for either of them. With Bonnie having to take care of Christy as she recovers from a concussion, she reluctantly agrees to let Danielle take care of Adam, who has a shoulder injury.
Absent: Sadie Calvano as Violet, Matt L. Jones as Baxter and Blake Garrett Rosenthal as Roscoe
Title meaning: Two things that Danielle provides for Adam while caring for him.

eps.name: Black Mold and an Old Hot Dog
eps.desc:
Despite feeling like she blew her interview with the Foster system administrator, Jill gets a call that they have a child for her. Expecting an infant, Jill learns the child is a 14-year old named Emily (Julia Lester), who has bounced around the system. Meanwhile, Bonnie learns the apartment complex management has asked the tenants to give her performance reviews.
Absent: William Fichtner as Adam, Sadie Calvano as Violet, Matt L. Jones as Baxter and Blake Garrett Rosenthal as Roscoe
Title meaning: Something Bonnie finds after cleaning an apartment shower and her description of a child that has been in the Foster system too long.
